meanings.definition: spaws (noun): the offspring of a fish or shellfish
meanings.sent1: The spaws swam gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught a bucket full of spaws.
meanings.sent3: The spaws played hide and seek among the coral reefs.
meanings.sent4: The spaws were like tiny jewels scattered in the water.
meanings.sent5: The spaws wiggled their way into the underwater world.

meanings.definition: spaws (verb): to give birth to fish or shellfish
meanings.sent1: The mother fish spaws new life into the sea.
meanings.sent2: The oyster spaws pearls in its shell.
meanings.sent3: The river spaws fish like a magical fountain.
meanings.sent4: The ocean spaws life in abundance.
meanings.sent5: The pond spaws tadpoles in the warm spring.

meanings.definition: spaws (adjective): relating to the birth or offspring of fish or shellfish
meanings.sent1: The spaws habitat was carefully protected by conservationists.
meanings.sent2: The spaws nursery provided a safe environment for the young fish.
meanings.sent3: The spaws festival celebrated the marine life of the region.
meanings.sent4: The spaws ecosystem was teeming with underwater activity.
meanings.sent5: The spaws environment was a vibrant underwater community.
